text: Aglaia foveolata is a species of tropical tree in the family Meliaceae. This plant occurs in Brunei, Indonesia, and Malaysia. It produces edible fruit. The bark contains silvestrol which is a potent inhibitor of ebola virus and Zika Virus replication. ==References== foveolata Category:Near threatened plants Category:Taxonomy articles created by Polbot
title: Aglaia foveolata
